resources.string: Report on the Company Britannia Industries with a stock market history of over 10 years.\n\n

History of Company : 
 a) The company was established in 1892 by a group of British businessmen with an investment of ₹295. Initially, biscuits were manufactured in a small house in central Kolkata.
 b) Later, the enterprise was acquired by the Gupta brothers, mainly Nalin Chandra Gupta, an attorney, and operated under the name "V.S. Brothers."
 c) In 1918, C.H. Holmes, an English businessman based in Kolkata, was taken on as a partner and The Britannia Biscuit Company Limited (BBCo) was launched.The Mumbai factory was set up in 1924 and Peek d) France UK, acquired a controlling interest in BBCo. Biscuits were in high demand during World War 2, which gave a boost to the company's sales.
 e) The company name was changed to the current "Britannia Industries Limited" in 1979.
 f) In 1982, the American company Nabisco Brands, Inc. acquired the parent of Peek Freans and became a major foreign shareholder.
\n Important Personalities and milestones of company over the years.

• The company has been mired in several controversies connected to its management. However, it still has a large market share and it is profitable.
 • Kerala businessman Rajan Pillai secured control of the group in the late 1980s, becoming known in India as the 'Biscuit Raja'.
 • In 1993, the Wadia Group acquired a stake in Associated Biscuits International (ABIL), and became an equal partner with Group Danone in Britannia Industries Limited.
 • In 1955 Britannia launched Bourbone biscuits which became one of the profitable product.
 • Economic Times ranked Britannia Industries as India 's 2nd most trusted branded in 2002.
 • Current CEO of Britannia is Varun Berry .
 • For the fiscal year ended March 2022, Britannia Industries consolidated net profit was down 18.08 percent to Rs. 1,515.98 crores.
 It had reported a net profit of Rs. 1,850.59 crores in 2020-21. Its total revenue from operations was Rs. 14,136.26 crore.

1) Moving Average :
 • By using the Moving average indicator the company’s share price has been increased to 17 times in the last ten years I.e. from Rs. 200 – Rs 3420
 • From 2015 to 2019 a bullish trend is observed. The stock price moved from s. 420 to Rs 3400.
 The company has performed very well in these 5 years.

2) Exponential Moving Average :
 An exponential moving average (EMA) is a type of moving(MA) that places a greater weight and significance on the most recent data points.
 ♦ Over 10 years, the graph of EMA and MA has been quite similar from the mid-year of 2020 to the current year 2022
 ♦ A sidewise trend is observed but in the month of September 2021, it broke the resistance level an again returned to follow the sidewise trend.

3) Relative Strength Index :
 The relative strength index (RSI) is a momentum indicator used in technical analysis that measures the magnitude of recent price changes to evaluate overbought or oversold conditions in the price of a stock or other asset.
 • Currently the value of RSI is 50 and is expected to increase based on previous trend.
 • On 1st July 2015, the value of RSI touched a value of 97.50 and at this point in time, it\’s a precarious situation to buy stock of the Britannia industry.
 • The value of RSI remained above 70 for a period of 18 months from 2014 July to 2015 December.
